website_summaries.verdict: This airbed gives you the best of both worlds – fast, built-in electric pump to inflate for house guests, plus the ability to use it with other pumps when you're out on the road.
pros: Perfect for camping in the bed of a truck
Stands up to teens and dogs
This mattress is also compatible with a battery-powered pump for camping
High-powered pump inflates mattress in approximately 3 minutes to the desired firmness
Indented sides keep your fitted sheets from slipping

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had great news to report...maybe it can be fixed?
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these, in anticipation of my kids visiting this weekend. Just opened the box on Friday, and filled them according to the directions. The next morning, one was completely empty, the other, was 25% deflated. Would love to get them replaced to see if it was just from a bad batch. Before you ask, no holes, can't find a slow leak either. Based on the lack of feedback, I would never buy from here again. Two of these, one use each, and no care from the seller.
customer_reviews.author: D. Martinek

customer_reviews.title: The perfect answer for camping in the bed of a truck.
customer_reviews.text: For camping use in the bed of my truck, this mattress is fantastic! By using a short extension cord to the power inverter in my truck, it takes only 1.5 minutes to inflate, and 2 minutes to deflate. Then folds up easily to fit in supplied bag. Fits two large adult males over 6 foot tall and easily handles nearly 600 pounds (I did say LARGE), and no rubbing shoulders all night.
customer_reviews.author: Triple Trouble

customer_reviews.title: Item shouldn't have passed quality control
customer_reviews.text: The air mattress arrived and I inflated it fully. I came back an hour later to put sheets on and it was, laying on the ground completely deflated. I read the manual, double checked the inflation/deflation switch and pump area and tried re-inflating. Less than an hour later it was back on the ground with barely any air inside. I really wanted to like this mattress because of the built-in pump and tall height, but in the end I was disappointed by the factory quality control. Amazon promptly issued a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Lost air from day 1
customer_reviews.text: Fresh out of the box, I pumped it up. It lost 50% of the air within a few hours. The instructions say that it's normal for it to appear deflated, due to the mattress material expanding or contracting - makes no sense to me - but the instructions say this will last only a few days, so I pumped it up (so it must have lost air) every day for 5 days, then tried to sleep on it. It did not hold air. It's a shame, because, when fully inflated, it's fairly comfortable. I am returning it. When returning, it's a pain to get the mattress back in the original box.
customer_reviews.author: Gary S.

customer_reviews.title: Should have been great...perhaps we just received two bad ones...
customer_reviews.text: We actually received two of these. The first one we received had been an obvious return. It was missing everything, such as paperwork etc. Once it was blown up it leaked henced the return from the first customer. Amazon was fantastic, as always, and sent a new mattress. This one was new, had the paperwork, wrapped in a protective plastic etc...but after two nights it developed a slow leak in the side seam where you cannot repair. Gave up and tossed.
customer_reviews.author: joelle morgan

customer_reviews.title: but this was rather more inexpensive and works just fine. I trust Intex
customer_reviews.text: I prefer to sleep on an air mattress rather than a standard mattress. I can control the soft/firm factor according to how I feel on any given day. This one fills the bill. I could buy a $2000 mattress that has air in it and I could control that as well, but this was rather more inexpensive and works just fine. I trust Intex, I like the push button fill control, and I even put an electric warming mattress cover on it during the winter without causing any problems. Seems to solve my sleeping situation. Try it, you may like it as much as I do.
customer_reviews.author: beege215

customer_reviews.title: Read the instructions
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of reviews are complaining about this mattress popping or leaking the first time you use it. The instructions clearly state to unbox this and blow it up before real use. Once you blow it up let it stretch out for a few hours. Then fill it with more air. I did this 3-4 times before putting away for a camping trip several weeks later. This mattress has since been blown up very firmly multiple times since and we've never had a problem. I think some folks are pulling this out of the box and blowing up minutes before flopping on it for the night. Stretch it out before sleeping on it. Don't go in dry rookies
customer_reviews.author: KyleG

customer_reviews.title: Lovin' it.
customer_reviews.text: My sister moved in with me and she has been sleeping on this bed now for 6 months. She loves the idea of being able to lift her bed up to create huge space in her room for her yoga. One suggestion for anyone considering doing the same, purchase a quality foam topper. It will accomplish two things: 1) create a softer landing platform, 2) create some warmth. Sleeping on air space can be a bit chilly. But for the price point, we are very happy with this product and the quality of it.
customer_reviews.author: Star

customer_reviews.title: Great Support design!
customer_reviews.text: Love the horizontal support design! Didn't pop its seams like the typical vertical support design. A previous one had lasted me nearly 3yrs of constant, daily use. Bought it as a "short term" solution for bedding and actually kept using it daily because it was so comfortable. Set it on a box spring and couldn't tell the difference between an air mattress and a regular mattress, other than this was more comfortable for me. The only problem with this one was that it only lasted me about 6wks. It started losing air and I couldn't locate the leak. I ended up having to purchase yet another one as sleeping on the floor isn't an option.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Baker

customer_reviews.title: Can't Believe My Luck
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this at the end of August in preparation for guests coming so there would be additional sleeping arrangement. Because of health issues they were unable to come until mid-November. Took the mattress out of the box for the first time and guess what ...found myself sleeping on the floor by morning. I have tried to use it all weekend with the same results. I have read and re-read the inflation instructions and am doing everything right. It just will not stay aired up. BTW A friend bought the same mattress at Wal Mart, with the very same results. Steer clear of this one!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hole after 2 uses.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was a great mattress the first two times I used it. I've brought it out again to use for the third time (I just bought this literally 3 weeks ago). There is already a hole somewhere in this thing and it deflates by half after someone sleeps on it for 7 hours. It's actually ridiculous and I wish I had taken other people's warnings more seriously. I'm so disappointed because I was really looking forward to having an inflatable mattress for visiting guests. It's not like this thing is cheap either!
customer_reviews.author: Ash_TK

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, but Loud
customer_reviews.text: I really like this mattress. It is easy to set up, does not require much air after initial inflation, and is pretty supportive. The only bad thing for me is how annoying the loud friction is from rolling over, which makes it hard to sleep. Also, if you don't have a good layer of sheets, you can hear your heartbeat/stomach digestion through the echo of the hollow mattress. But you should have no problem if noise doesn't bother you.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Won't stay inflated.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for emergencies or when I had unexpected guest and then didn't do what I should have done when I received it. I didn't test it. So I left it in the closet for almost a year before pulling it out to use it. It inflated rapidly so that was great but within 2 hours it was flat on the floor. Tried everything we could think of to repair the leaky seems but never could get it to hold. It was way past warranty dates so we had no choice but to throw it out. Not a happy camper so I won't recommend it which is sad because I usually have good luck with Intex.
customer_reviews.author: DMichaelMc

customer_reviews.title: ... find sleeping on an air mattress is the most comfortable for me
customer_reviews.text: I have severe spine damage and find sleeping on an air mattress is the most comfortable for me. This Intex mattress is perfect for me, it's a very good quality air mattress. The Queen can support 3 teenagers comfortably if need be. I am 5'2", 115 lbs. I do need to use very deep pocket fitted sheets to cover it. It is a very high mattress so I do not use a box spring under it. I have a 9" platform and with the mattress fully inflated, it totals about 23" from the floor to top of mattress. Not included in those measurements is the 2" memory foam topper I use for my need of extra cushioning.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: BIG DISAPPOINTMENT. LEAKING FROM WHERE HARD PLASTIC PUMP PLATE IS JOINED TO VINYL
customer_reviews.text: This is an update, After using the air mattress about 20-25 times it started to lose air from the hard plastic built-in pump where it joins the vinyl mattress. I need to fill with air every evening I use it and by morning it has lost 1/2 the air. I am very disappointed and don't know if the leaf can be fixed. Useless since it won't hold air. Waste of money. Other than leaking, useless, and waste of money it did hold its shape and had firm sides.
customer_reviews.author: Valarie Boro

customer_reviews.title: Leaks....do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: This bed leaked from the first time I used it! Looses about half of the air. I would not buy it again nor would I recommend it....do NOT buy it! I would return it, but waited too long. I had it about two weeks before I first used it, then thought I must have not closed the valve enough, so I blamed the leakage on myself. The next time I used it two weeks later, it leaked again, but then the return window had closed! So I say do not buy this product!
customer_reviews.author: topshopper541

customer_reviews.title: Giant bubble, replacement was interesting.
customer_reviews.text: Worked as described for 1 week then a giant bubble appeared in the middle of the bed on the front and bottom. It was unreal. Not good and dangerous. Was sent a replacement, exact same model, but somehow it was smaller. For real it was about 4 inches smaller on each side. Two exact same products, but the size and shape was different. Inconsistent and not good product.
customer_reviews.author: HamRadioElijah

customer_reviews.title: Besides the initial set up being as easy as instructed- plug it in and inflate it- it ...
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this and immediately took on vacation as an extra bed for two 15 year old girls. Besides the initial set up being as easy as instructed- plug it in and inflate it- it was so convenient and the girls absolutely loved sleeping on this. They said it was the most comfortable inflatable bed they've ever been on. We had a 7 day, 6 night vacation so they slept on this bed for 6 nights and absolutely raved about it. Would highly recommend this to others. When the vacation was over, I slid the bed over to an outlet and simply plugged it in and deflated the bed and folded it up. Amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Steiniger

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. I've used this three times for guests when ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I've used this three times for guests when they spend the night. It inflates within a few minutes and it's very user-friendly. It loses a little bit of air but that's a common thing with air mattresses and it might be because I haven't stretched out the material enough. It's also noisy when you move around, even if it's just to shift your body to a different position. But it was an affordable and functional alternative to a sleeper sofa so I'm keeping it!
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: Started leaking after only 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed this mattress for the first 6 months I used it, but it then began to leak which only got worse and worse. I read reviews on amazon and elsewhere online and it appears there are known leak issues from the integrated pump. I spent a lot of time trying to seal these numerous leaks with glue to no avail. The mattress continues to deflate every night. Apparently this is a known issue by Intex but they refuse to address it. Steer clear of this air mattress if you want something that will stand the test of time.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse E.

customer_reviews.title: At first it was perfect used for my grand daughter to nap on
customer_reviews.text: At first it was perfect used for my grand daughter to nap on. She used it twice, today she comes in and from yesterday to this morning it's flat. Mind you nobody uses this mattress except the two times she napped on it. Why it suddenly went flat is beyond me. Had it gone flat within a mo I would have sent it back but it's been 2 mos. this was the bed I was going to use for her she's not yet 2 and if she fell out it wouldn't be that far but now it's junk won't hold air!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Underwood

customer_reviews.title: It makes a very nice and comfortable guest bed
customer_reviews.text: It makes a very nice and comfortable guest bed, packs up small and its not as loud as some other air beds, its not completely silent but it will not wake you up while turning in your sleep. You might need to pump it up after first 3-4 nights (as the material will stretch initially) and once a week after that. Built in pump makes it easy and fast to do in less than a minute. It will make the bed very firm too, i usually don't pump it up all the way up.
customer_reviews.author: K Dz

customer_reviews.title: We Love It !!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We love this mattress !!! We never have a problem with it deflating !!! Some times it softens a little, just a little, after sleeping on it the first night but a quick hit on the switch and it is back up to really firm and then usually stays there, it has never deflated or gotten really soft !!! We use it all the time when we have company over or when our Grandkids stay the night. We have friends who have purchased them after seeing how great ours was!!! It so easy to set up and to store, great to have on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie S

customer_reviews.title: Good bed at a great price
customer_reviews.text: This review is being written after only one night's use so far, so I can't speak yet to longevity. I love this bed! The choices to find a full-sized mattress (most make them in twin or queen only) with a built-in pump were very limited, and at $46, this was a real find. I use this camping in a smallish "4-person" 9' X 7' tent, so it's the perfect size. I bring a car jump-start battery unit with built-in AC power inverter to power the inflator, though it is possible to manually inflate with other smaller inflators when away from household AC outlets. In my first night's use, the bed barely softened/deflated at all by the following morning.
customer_reviews.author: East Bay Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Missed the return window. Loses a LOT of air. Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, it took me more than 30 days to fully test the bed. I kept hoping that it was still in "stretch" mode and not really losing air. This thing loses air without even laying on it! Like, a LOT of air. Totally nonfunctional. I'm so pissed I missed the return window. Otherwise, this bed would have been perfect and was exactly what I was looking for. Not a lot of options for full-size mattresses that don't break the bank. What a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: It features an integrated pump which is an extremely nice feature - no more hand pumps or blowing it ...
customer_reviews.text: This air mattress is a solid buy for the price. It features an integrated pump which is an extremely nice feature - no more hand pumps or blowing it up manually. The mattress is reasonably comfortable. I wouldn't want to spend a week on it but for overnight visitors, its perfect. The internal baffles seem to work well - it holds it shape when inflated and pressure is well equalized. It holds air well, it does appear to lose a little pressure overnight, but it doesn't leave you on the floor when you wake up. For the price, its great. I haven't had any complaints from guests who have slept on it.
customer_reviews.author: 44CLuTCH

customer_reviews.title: Wish i could say something good
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this mattress back in June to use in our camper . But things happened and we never went camping until the weekend of 9/10/2016.. took the mattress out of the box and inflated it .. it filled up quickly and was quite comfortable, but within 2 hrs we realized it lost air.. inflated again and went to sleep.. after 4 hrs we woke up and refilled again.. same thing 4 hrs later .. this went on our entire camping excursion.. got home and filled again.. checked on it 5 days later and it is completely void of any air.. completely deflated.. sad, because it was comphy.. the 30 day return expired so I'm stuck ..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice bed! Easy and quick to inflate and deflate ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice bed! Easy and quick to inflate and deflate and folded back up to fit into the bag it came with! I like that I can add air to make it soft or firm! Slept on it 1st night and it lost a wee bit of air but was the first time I had used it. 2nd night it stayed fully inflated! I did use a couple thick blankets under me because I felt cold. As some have stated airbeds are not warm and I found that to be true. I would purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: julie

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold up with use
customer_reviews.text: In the past 3 years I bought 3 of these mattresses. The 1st lasted nearly 2 yrs. The 2nd around 1 year. Just replaced 2nd one in March and it's already loosing air! It is very comfortable and easy to fill when it's not leaking. The price was right but, I would've been better off buying a less cheap mattress. Has cost more than it should've. Very disappointed because it is perfect for what I need. Comfortable sleep!
customer_reviews.author: Carol Andree

customer_reviews.title: Leaks air
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mattress in 2016 and finally busted it out to use it. It stated all over not to return it if it deflates because it's stretching out. I have now spent 4 nights on it and I have had to refill it 3-4 times a night because I am almost on the floor! I haven't found any clear holes/leaks but it seems to be slowlty leaking from somewhere. I wish I opened it earlier so I could return it. However, now that I have done some investigating it seems that this is a common complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Seller22

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use - decently comfy for an air mattress
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for camping but actually ended up using it for a week when our mattress was damaged during a move. Not the most comfortable bed out there but it held the air really well, was easy to inflate and deflate, and we didn't have any leaks after using it for a week straight. While I'd definitely prefer an actual mattress, I wouldn't have any qualms about having guests use it overnight for a couple nights.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Marie

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: I needed a blow up mattress in a hurry. I had gotten a job and had to relocate. I was staying with my sister until I found a place, so I was huffing it in her living room for about 3 months. Towards the end of the 3 months it had sprung a leak and I would have to I flame in before going to bed each night. I would wake up in a slump. I'm sure of I wanted to invest in patching it, iI would still be in use. It's a great quality mattress, I used it to the max, I'm sure it's meant for a few night use at a time.
customer_reviews.author: BrandiD

customer_reviews.title: Two duds now-no more Intex!!
customer_reviews.text: I have now had two of these mattresses and, honestly, I won't get another one!! The first one only lasted a few months of use and the second one was used only 8 nights before it started to deflate during the night to the point that the sleeper's butt would be on the floor by morning!! It was only used intermittently and with normal use and care. We are in the middle of an extended trip and will need the use of an inflatable air mattress before the trip is over, so we will now have to find a store to buy one!! These are not well made at all!!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Must have for campers, guests, or lifes adventures.
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. Officially I have bought 5, keep loaning them to friends who inevitably keep them and want one of their own....so to Amazon I go. Easy, unfold, plug in, power on 30 to 45 seconds later....tadah, guest bed. To deflate simply dial the release nozzle and shes flat. The cord stores in the mattress/charging compartment and you get a great drawstring bag with it for proper storage. (If you prefer it softer the simply release some air from air nozzle, firmer....power it up and add more air.)
customer_reviews.author: SuzieQ

customer_reviews.title: What happened?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this air mattress for my son as he was traveling for work. When it arrived, it was easy to set up and that first night was the first night of a good night's sleep and was very comfortable. After approximately 1 1/2- 2 weeks, the mattress started loosing air in the middle of the night until it was deflated by the morning. This never got better until a friend offered him to borrow an extra mattress of his [a different brand] . It is reportedly not as comfortable as the Intex recreation mattress BUT it does not predictably deflate. Is this a freak occurrence or is this typical ? I would like Intex to make this right.
customer_reviews.author: hopeful

customer_reviews.title: Ruined my Thanksgiving
customer_reviews.text: after only 4 uses mattress started to deflate by itself. When i called Intex I was told it only had a 90 day warranty. i had it since May of this year (I bought it specifically so my daughters friends could stay over and for the holiday season when I have company stay as well) fortunately Amazon customer service was more helpful in this matter. I urge people not to purchase items from this company as they are no help in fixing a shoddy product
customer_reviews.author: jeff mantel

customer_reviews.title: worked for almost 2 months; now have to throw out and buy another brand
customer_reviews.text: I have been sleeping on this full size Intex 13" mid-rise since middle of March. It has been steadily losing more air, so that now I have to reinflate every other day. Also, the edges of this mattress sink way down every time I sit on.it. I had purchased this 13" high model to put on top of an existing box spring. I really wanted a 9" just like an A brand air mattress with comfort zones that I have been using in my vacation home for 8 years, but that model is no longer available.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazingly comfortable, self-inflating air mattress
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazingly comfortable, self-inflating air mattress. I slept on it for approximately three weeks while waiting for my furniture to arrive. I frequently have guests sleep on it, and they always remark how comfortable it is. It inflates and deflates quickly, and stays inflated when the valve is closed. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Max Ellithorpe

customer_reviews.title: Will not stay inflated
customer_reviews.text: This mattress will not consistently stay inflated. I purchased this air mattress on less than a month ago. I use an air mattress every night. This one is comfortable if you can keep it inflated. The first 3 nights the mattress deflated. I thought I read the instructions wrong I decided to turn the dial back counter clockwise just a little bit (after inflating) this worked, it stayed inflated but this only worked for about two weeks and now it deflates within an 3 hours of being blown up (not just a little air loss, flattened out on the floor). There is no hole, this is a defect for sure, Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Woods & Jennifer Gebbia

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give it zero stars I would! The idea of it was nice, the initial laying on it was comfy.....however it would NOT hold air the very first time using it! I kept waking up on the ground (roughly about 8 times) so I asked for a return, Amazon was great, as they usually are. I asked for a replacement because I thought maybe it was just defective and we still needed an air mattress for camping. Replacement came.....exact same thing happened the first use with the replacement one!! So frustrated! Had to send it back as well and just ask for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Atara83

customer_reviews.title: Was nice at first...
customer_reviews.text: At first couple uses, it was very good. It met and exceeded my expectations. It was comfy and spacious enough for two. However, almost immediately after the deadline to return this mattress, a leak sprung somewhere near the autofill thing. Its somewhere on the seam of of the plastic and the rubber so I can't even figure out how to patch it. Very unsatisfied at my purchase. (Normal use, indoors, no children jumping on it)
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Quickly becomes difficult to inflate
customer_reviews.text: We've used this no more than 10-15 times/nights in the 16 months that we've bought it and it no longer inflates efficiently. When we turn it on it inflates a few seconds then stops again. If we come back an hour later to try again the same thing happens. We just don't have that kind of time when we're hosting guests or traveling. Apparently the warranty also only covers 90 days which is not enough time for most people's use of air mattresses, which is infrequent. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, comfortable to sleep on. Inflates and Deflates easily. We are using this in our motor home on top of the old pull out sofa as that was getting uncomfortable. When delfated it actually can stay on the sofa and fold up like the regular mattress did. I am not sure how long it might do this, but for the price, convenience and comfort it's so worth it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Brookwell

customer_reviews.title: I Regret This Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I honestly do not understand the 4/5 star ratings. This mattress is the worst! I purchased this mattress a few months ago during Prime Day and finally had the chance to use it this last week. First day, the mattress had a slow leak. Second day, the mattress had a not so slow leak. Third day, I woke up on the floor after 2 hours of sleep. My advice is not to waste your money since you may end up on the floor anyway. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: lvngthelf

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews which were somewhat mixed I went ahead and ordered this product. I read the instructions. The instructions tell you to inflate and deflate the product periodically over a few days to accomodate stretching of the material. I inflated it yesterday and today it is still hard as a rock. I am happy with my purchase! One weird thing I did notice is grubby hand prints on the sleeping side of the air mattress when I inflated the mattress for the first time. There was also some dirt or sand residue... I'm almost thinking it's a factory QC issue and not returned and sold as new. I'm not too worried about it... but one star off for that.
customer_reviews.author: Ben G

customer_reviews.title: Great first time around. And then...
customer_reviews.text: This mattress worked great the first time I used it for house guests. But upon second use by other guests it was fully deflated by morning. I'm unable to contact the manufacturer to request a refund or replacement, as too much time has passed. I'm very disappointed by this product. I have a smaller mattress from another manufacturer that holds year time after time, year after year.
customer_reviews.author: D-Ronk

customer_reviews.title: Amazing price for a great mattress
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to have when my grandson spends the night. It's great! I knew ahead of time that it was going to stretch out the first night and require more air so I took that into account. I haven't had any air loss at all. It's been perfect. I do put a mattress pad on before the sheets for warmth but other than that there isn't anything I have to do. I love that the air can be adjusted for each persons individual comfort level. This is an amazing price for such a great mattress.
customer_reviews.author: R. SineTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: This is unfortunate since it looks like a sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The first time we used the mattress, right out of the box, we discovered that it had a slow leak. There was no way for us to trace the leak and patch it. This is unfortunate since it looks like a sturdy, supportive mattress. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Reb

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, quick setup, very comfortable.  does leak a bit of air.
customer_reviews.text: Would like to give this 5 stars. Its inexpensive. the built in pump works well and it inflates fast. its very comfortable. I threw out my regular mattress and have just been using this until I move soon as I didn't want to drag a mattress with me. The only criticism I have is it sometimes leaks some air. the odd thing is while im sleeping on it it doesn't do it. I can sleep all night and it might lose a very small amount of air but when it does it the most is when im 'not' on it. which is odd. But overall value of this product I cant really complain I was a worthwhile purchase.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: It's a very comfortable bed, but it does not last long
customer_reviews.text: It's a very comfortable bed, but it does not last long. I bought two of these, I chalked the first one up to a fluke and bought another one because it was one of the more comfortable air beds I've slept on. The second one was inflated maybe 5 times before it stopped holding air and I couldn't find the leak anywhere. If you're looking for a 1 time use this is a great cheap option, if you're looking for something to use over and over again for frequent company look somewhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: It was great for a little while. Used the bed about three times per week, on carpet. After 35 days it doesn't hold the air any more, slowly deflating after inflation. The return policy gives 30 days, so I'm screwed. Waste of money. I've had a few Intex beds, and none of them have lasted longer than 6 months, with sporadic use. This one was used more often, and it's trash much sooner. I'm done with this brand.
customer_reviews.author: KayDeeDub

customer_reviews.title: It was so comfortable I replaced it hoping the leak was a fluke
customer_reviews.text: I ended up going through three of these. The first one sprung a leak after two uses. It was so comfortable I replaced it hoping the leak was a fluke. The second was delivered with a tear in it somewhere - the first night I used it I ended up on the floor. That one was replaced with my third one. The third one lasted while I had visitors in town but also ended up deflating. It's too bad because it really was very comfortable for an air mattress and a good price. Also very easy to inflate!
customer_reviews.author: Lilita

customer_reviews.title: not like a hole but a slow leak that couldn't be ...
customer_reviews.text: Never did pump clear up from day 1. After about 3 uses started losing air, not like a hole but a slow leak that couldn't be found. Only had a 30 day return policy so by the time I realized it was too late to return. Very disappointed with mattress and seller.
customer_reviews.author: kB

customer_reviews.title: Progressive Air Leakage From Day 1
customer_reviews.text: The mattress lost air every night during the first week of use, despite daily topping off with the built in fan. For the two nights before use, the mattress was fully inflated and topped off to account for normal stretching. Then it was used nightly for a week by a couple together weighing 310 lbs. Every morning enough air had leaked out that despite daily topping off, a hand placed on the empty bed could be depressed by about 6 inches. There is likely an occult leak somewhere, probably gradually enlarging. Fortunately the built in fan facilitates refilling, although it is still inconvenient to unmake and move the bed to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewator

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad to have bought it.
customer_reviews.text: My parents were coming to visit and my oldest daughter who is in college was coming home at the same time, so I decided to buy this air bed for whoever wants to use it. My parents decided to sleep on the bed and the next day they said they had a good night sleep for it was comfortable. I'm glad I bought this. Now, I don't have to worry when we have company spending the night at our tiny house.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: As firm as an "actual matress"
customer_reviews.text: First use was on a camping trip. Using an adapter I was able to plug it into my car's power source and it inflated itself in about 3 minutes. Nice and firm.. very comfortable to sleep on (and it withstood other "bed-specific" rigors). Deflating was just as easy. This was one of my best purchases of the year. It'll get plenty of use on camping trips and at home for over night guests.
customer_reviews.author: michaeld

customer_reviews.title: Great mattress
customer_reviews.text: We had family coming to visit for Thanksgiving so I bought this for extra sleeping accommodations. I was amazed that it was fully inflated in about 2 minutes with the built-in inflator. It deflates just as fast, using the pump, sucking ALL of the air out to make it compact for bagging. We only used it for 7 nights, but it never lost air and it was easy to adjust the firmness. We left it up the whole time, but it would be very easy to inflate/deflate if you need the room.
customer_reviews.author: Skyhawk

customer_reviews.title: Deflates over time
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these. They last about 6 months. They deflate when you apply pressure to the sides while sitting or getting out of bed. By 6 or so months they start deflating overnight and do so progressively faster each night, until I can only get about 4 hours of sleep before I'm sinking into the steel frames of my bed frame. (Ouch)
customer_reviews.author: ORION

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but doesn't seem to hold up
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for medical purposes. It's comfortable and the pump works very well. But I've only had it a couple of months and it hasn't been holding air so well over the last few weeks. Each morning, I deflate it and fold it up to put it out of the way. After about a month, I started to get small holes in the stitching near the built-in pump. I sealed them but there seems to be more and more of them appearing. Not a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: Todd A. Voge

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mattress a few months ago for my friends who come frequently from out of town. It doesn't hold air for a full night just like a lot of the other reviewers mention. I thought the deflating was because I didn't stretch it out after first use, but after using it multiple times since and stretching it, the same problem keeps occurring. No holes. I wish I could return it but I took too long. I even purchased a few $7.47 twin sized air mattresses from Wal-Mart for a party we through and they are a million times better than this piece of s***.
customer_reviews.author: dredreb

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: We had family coming into town so we needed some extra beds. We bought this and fallowed the instructions about blowing the mattress up and letting it sit overnight. It did not deflate throughout the night. It was really nice to blow it up just by plugging it in. It can also do the same to deflate it! Those who slept on it said it was very comfortable (we had it on wood floors). It was simple and easy to set up and take down. It’s higher off the ground making it easy to get up without having to go from the floor to standing. It’s almost the height of our bed.
customer_reviews.author: Moonborne

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.text: Great inflatable bed and at a great price. My sister was visiting and the inflatable bed I had intended to use had sprung a leak. So I went on Amazon and found this bed. Because of my Amazon Prime membership it arrived the day my sister did. So I hoped for the best when I inflated this bed. IT IS GREAT! It is more comfortable than my regular mattress. I have never slept so well. I used it for a week. There were no leaks and only occasional needs to put a bit more air in it. HIGHLY RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.author: Dan in Baltimore

customer_reviews.title: Six days use OK, mattress now has slow leak,,, irreparable,
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mattress a year ago and slept on it for six nights, The first 2-3 days it needed pumping up a bit each night (due to stretching?) then seems to hold a good pressure, I stored it carefully and used it again this year, The mattress will not hold pressure, Not even for 2 hours! Had to buy a new one locally and that errand put a big hole in our trip, When I got home I inflated and washed with soapy water to try and find a leak, No Luck, My guess is it’s a bad valve, I loose, I do not trust Intel products
customer_reviews.author: Jim Young

customer_reviews.title: This is the most comfortable air mattress I have ever slept on
customer_reviews.text: This is the most comfortable air mattress I have ever slept on. I ordered this mattress when going to a convention with some friends and slept on it for almost a week. My back gets stiff easily and I am overweight. But I never had issues with back pain and only had to top off the air once during th week (took about 5 seconds before it was perfect again). There was easily enough room for my wife and the price was great. We're going to order a couple for home eventually for when we have guests over. I swear this mattress was more comfortable than our old guest beds anyway!
customer_reviews.author: Chris P. Zogheib

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I needed this right away for family that was arriving the next day. I ordered it online and I received it the same day. It blows up easily and stores nicely in the convenient bag that comes with it. We only had to re-inflate once during their stay. It was used for five days so having to re-inflate once was not bad. Note: The same bed cost much more at Walmart so Amazon's price point is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: TxStarlett

customer_reviews.title: Lived on it for 6 months
customer_reviews.text: It eventually got a leak that i couldnt find or fix but the 6 months that i needed it it was there for me. I figure i got my money's worth. Also, keep in mind me and my CAT with all her claws lived on it for 6 months. LOL I would purchase another one for guests. I figure it'll last very long when using occasionally without a cat. RIP to it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Glad I got this!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our son because his apartment isn't big enough for the queen-sized one we got him last year. He just had friends visit and this filled up in about 15 minutes. They slept on it four nights and didn't have to re-inflate it at all. I read the reviews on this before I bought it and was worried about what others said about it not staying inflated, but my husband told me Intex is an excellent brand and it turned out to be an excellent purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kibbles

customer_reviews.title: Love the mattress
customer_reviews.text: Love the mattress! It is easy to inflate with the self-inflatable pump in built into it. We had company that used it for a whole month and they only had to add a little air to it once during their visit! They said it was very comfortable for an airbed. When our company left it was easy to deflate by reversing the air pump that is built in. I folded it up and store it in the cloth bag that it came in.
customer_reviews.author: Ella Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Good air mattress for sleeping on at a decent price!
customer_reviews.text: Great for sleeping on! Lint loves the creases and crevices on the top of the mattress which is a bit annoying, but a handy hand broom or brush will help get the lint off with ease. Just be careful not to puncture the bottom of the mattress when folding it up. We punctured ours this way, the motor actually poked a hole in the bottom of the mattress when we folded it up. However the patch kit provided made for an easy fix.
customer_reviews.author: J.Gross

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality. Came with leaks.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in December and have used it only once. The mattress barely stays inflated for more than an hour. It came with a leak and we cant find it. Poor quality. The retailer is not responsive either. I'm not sure how to get a replacement. But, when the mattress is inflated, it is comfortable and solid.
customer_reviews.author: Nilah M

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: First time ever had this happen, Intex has always been good, bought this one got a slow leak around motor area. Returned that one, bought another one, same thing happened. Wanted to try this higher type mattress, we noticed it came from the very last section on bottom, it never fully inflated, softer than upper part, rest of the mattress needed to be reinflated periodically. It's more than 30 days so can not return product, but not sure the rubber is as sturdy on this new type.
customer_reviews.author: shopper

customer_reviews.title: Can't even hold the weight of a child
customer_reviews.text: Deflated after 1 night of my 10 year old niece sleeping on it. Horrible quality. Does not hold air. I followed the package directions and inflated it several days in advance to "let it stretch" but it still would not support the weight of a 70-pound child for even 1 full night. She woke up basically on the floor in the morning since it had completely deflated through the night. Very disappointing product.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable IF it held air!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Intex air mattress that I have had in the past two years that lasted less than a year. Both times, the issue is something with the inflator assembly leaking and the mattress is flat by morning. I have checked both mattresses using dish soap and a sponge to confirm there is no leak in the mattress itself. Intex does not stand behind their products and does not offer a warranty. The section of their website to contact them conveniently has never worked when I tried. Time to find a new mattress to replace the Intex garbage that won't leak.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Anderson

customer_reviews.title: BEST value for an air mattress on the market
customer_reviews.text: Easily the best value for an airmattress on the market. Inflates quickly WITH the inflator built into the mattress and is very comfortable for an air mattress. I brought this along on a MDW vacation where my friend and I slept on it and it was so comfy! My friend liked the air mattress/value so much she actually bought one for herself as well. Don't bother running to target or anything as you will easily spend 2x the amount on an air mattress and an inflator. The air mattress also comes with patches ad a nice carrying bag as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsti Cookinham

customer_reviews.title: Great until it deflated
customer_reviews.text: This was a great air mattress that lasted me a little over a year. Then it started deflating after being blown up and I could never figure out where from. There were no holes in the air mattress yet it slowly deflated through the night. The height of the mattress was great and so were the automatic controls to blow it up/deflate it. I will probably end up buying another one since it's a great price and hopefully can last another year.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: It is sturdy and well-constructed
customer_reviews.text: I did a fair amount of researching before making this purchase. It is sturdy and well-constructed. The mattress "stretches" a bit after the first night, so a bit more inflation is needed to top it off. It is incredibly comfortable, and not very noisy when you shift around. The mattress has a soft velvety top, and comes with a carrying case. The electric pump is easy to use and the mattress inflates in about 2 minutes. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: A.P.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bed for staging our house
customer_reviews.text: Perfect bed for staging our house. I needed a substantial blow-up mattress for staging our house to sell. It was difficult finding a full-size/double. This mattress is the perfect size. After the sale of the house, I am sure we will use it for camping because it is very comfortable. Thanks for making the double/full size!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy C. Duus

customer_reviews.title: it appeared fine. The next time I inflated it was for ...
customer_reviews.text: This may be a fluke, but the air mattress that I received already had a leak in it when it arrived. I inflated in once as the packaging said to let it stretch out and test it before use, it appeared fine. The next time I inflated it was for a guest to sleep on (the reason I bought it) and it slowly deflated throughout the night so that my guest was on the floor by morning. It appears there is a leak somewhere around the seal, but I haven't investigated further. Since the product came damaged I'm simply going to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Elliot Cleberg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great air mattress - firm, strong material. There was no odor. Set up is amazingly easy. The bag has to stretch, and this takes a few days, and during that time, it appears to leak. But, you just inflate it for a minute, or less, and it's fine. I wish I had bought one years ago. I would recommend it to anyone. It is HUGE, much larger than I expected, more like a queen-sized mattress - be aware of that. I didn't plan for it, or read the measurements, and spent the rest of the evening rearranging furniture.
customer_reviews.author: Mark E. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Got this over prime day I think, or some other great sale. One of the best purchases I’ve made. Considering how many guests I’ve had coming through ya apt, I’m surprised I didn’t get one earlier. I slept on one when I visited a friend in Denver though and was inspired. Its super fast and easy to inflate, and deflate. The top is comfy and I throw sheets on it anyway. Makes crashing at my place way more civilized.
customer_reviews.author: oochmpgnoo

customer_reviews.title: UTTAH GAHBAGE
customer_reviews.text: It only took about 3 months for the stitches on the inside of the bed to come undone causing a huge bubble to sprout in the middle of the bed. Rendering it completely unusable. The built in pump also stopped working. This all conveniently happened just after the 3month warranty had expired. I move around often and have purchased several inflatable mattresses to save space when moving and have always had issues with Intex products. This is the last time I ever buy another one of your horrible mattresses. I will tell everyone I know the horrors of your useless brand! Puke!!
customer_reviews.author: Andi-Rae Wentworth

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy!  IT LEAKS !!!
customer_reviews.text: Do Not Buy this! It leaks and it comes with a tag that says “This doesn’t leak it just stretches out so just add more air “ Only 90 day warranty and it took more than 90 days to give up on adding and finally find the leak around the pump in the video with soapy water.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda C

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the price, but deflates over weeks.
customer_reviews.text: I think Intex generally makes good products for the price. This mattress does what you would expect. I was OK with the comfort level. It does leak over, say, a couple weeks; but the integrated motor quickly pumps it back up.
customer_reviews.author: Reed White

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these for a camping trip last fall. The main feature we were looking for is setup/teardown time and ease. We 1st tested it at home to set expectations for the trip. The pump provided makes it so easy to inflate and deflate and the process takes less than 3-4 minutes. Also comfort wise this is comparable to normal mattress comfort and we had no issues with back aches with these mattresses. Since our trip we have used it for guests and it works well. Overall very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: BJayPai

customer_reviews.title: Slow leak
customer_reviews.text: This bed ended up with a leak in it somewhere shortly after purchase. The worst part was my poor guests slept on it without mentioning that they had to reinflate it multiple times at night. I didn't know that it had sprung a leak until I used it while I was camping and found myself sleeping on the hard ground with no way to reinflate it. This thing is a piece of garbage with very poor quality control and I don't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Walk2345

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: We use our air bed in our Kia Soul when we want to camp without setting up a tent. Is able to be powered by a car (though you need a plug adaptor) and it inflates FAST. When you're done with it you reverse the airflow and turn it back on and it empties out entirely within a minute or two. The instructions that come with the mattress are thorough for packing and care, and it comes with a storage bag that actually fits the deflated mattress.
customer_reviews.author: JaraSaneRilian

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit leery of using this bed, being aware that you get what you pay for and it’s one of the cheaper full size air beds on Amazon. However, I inflated it for the first time and my friend stayed on it for two nights and it held up just fine. I didn’t have to add air during her stay and she said it was reasonably comfortable. We’ll see if it stands the rest of time but so far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: This bed could not hold air
customer_reviews.text: Our guest woke up on the floor, what little air that remained in the bed looked to swallow her up. The instructions said to leave it inflated for a while. For us that meant refilling it every few hours. The end result is that this bed will not hold air for 8 hours. If all you want to do is take a quick nap - you're ok as long as you refill it every time. we've tried it about 8 times. We never expected it not to work and by the time we realized it was a lemon the 90 day period had expired.
customer_reviews.author: dorothy kent

customer_reviews.title: I have to refill frequently, so I probably would not purchase this again
customer_reviews.text: I have had it about 3 months as an indoor guest bed / reading Nook and have to refill it just about every night. It bows a quite bit in the center. I have it on a bed frame. I wish there were a way to determine when I have filled it, I'm afraid of overfilling it and having it burst. The On/ Off switch to fill it with air is easy to use, so I like that feature.
customer_reviews.author: Deliberate Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Won't stay inflated... be prepared to deal with this several times/night!
customer_reviews.text: This worked really well... until right after the return and product support window closed (2 months).... now it won't stay inflated! We're up every 2-3 hours re-inflating it. Pretty upset that it can't be returned and now we're stuck with something completely useless!!!!!! Don't buy this unless you're looking to throw away your money!
customer_reviews.author: Tethorp

customer_reviews.title: Ridin low
customer_reviews.text: I got this bed in July to replace the last one we had, of the same brand, which lasted about a year. You know I don’t expect much out of an air mattress because I’ve never found one that isn’t garbage. But for the price we figured if we have to buy one every year it’s not a big deal. Last night was the second time I’ve used it, and I woke up ON THE FLOOR, while my friend rides high next to me on a different brand mattress. I mean the price for the mattress is good, but I might as well save my money and get a hotel room if I have to replace it after every use.
customer_reviews.author: abigail bradley

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Air Mattress
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up; deflates quickly when taking it down, but remained fully inflated for three straight nights without needing a refill. The bed is very comfortable and the notches on the mattress hold the fitted sheet in place. I debated for almost a week, reading reviews and comparing the available air mattresses on Amazon before deciding and we are so happy that we purchased this mattress It comes with a duffel tote for storage and transportation, and I am able to get the deflated mattress into the duffle on my own.
customer_reviews.author: M. Acuna

customer_reviews.title: Multiple leaks on seams within a few uses!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great product the first couple times we used it. About a month ago we started getting leaks along the seams. We repaired the first one and we quickly realized that there were several others. A little disappointing that this airbed only lasted a few uses. I have bought super cheap ones that have lasted longer than this. I would return this if I wasnt out of my return window. You live and learn I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Jones

customer_reviews.title: Ended up in a dumpster before the 3rd use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mattress for camping trips and I was pleased, at first. I used it twice, four nights total, and I was pleased. But the third time I used it, it was leaking air from the time I plugged it in to inflate it. Plus, the patches included with the set have NO adhesive included, so useless when miles away. I take very good care of my things, store my equipment indoors, and this mattress ended up in a dumpster before the third use. This is expensive trash.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Broussard

customer_reviews.title: Leaked after 1 use! Maybe mine was a fluke, but went with another brand as a replacement.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a standard air mattress, but I was very surprised that after using it once it got a hole and I have had to replace it. Maybe I just got a fluke bad one, since this does have good reviews. I know that eventually all air mattresses get holes and leak, I just wasn't expecting it to happen after using it only once for 1 night! Very disappointing, so ended up getting a new one at Walmart, and decided to steer away from this brand and bought a Coleman one, which I have owned in the past with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: EYBmore

customer_reviews.title: Is I spend my money on them air mattress and they do not work.
customer_reviews.text: Every last one of my air mattress has a defect if them they work for like about 2 or 3 weeks and after that the air just keep on coming out of the air mattresses and I have bought three of your air mattresses one is a twin size one is a queen size and one is a king size
customer_reviews.author: Antoinette Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Good for the first part, not the second and etc.
customer_reviews.text: So this bed was really great My guest were comfortable for the time using it. But the second and third time blowing up the bed. The air kept escaping and there are no holes whatsoever. Now it really started to deflate the forth time for my guest, I had to go buy a bed at the store. It kind of sucks because this bed is really noce but it deflates so much that we have to pump air every 2 hours or it'll get uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Janine

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Useless piece of junk. Leaks through the pump when valve is turned off. You can hear air leaking through intake valve. I have pumped it up several times following instructions and it completely deflates over night. I made mistake of waiting 30 days before trying it out and now past return window.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Williams

customer_reviews.title: 4 years later
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these in 2015. We've used them numerous times. I love how easy they are to inflate and delflate. I do wish they were easier to fold up and fit back in the bag.I'm having to replace one as it is leaking. I'm pretty certain a couple of the grandkids were jumping on it. I'm buying another one!
customer_reviews.author: cpres

customer_reviews.title: So far so good! Used it for a 4day weekend and it ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Used it for a 4day weekend and it stayed firm through the night. Every morning i had to add a little more air but for sure better the the cheap air mattress I had before. Im about 130 lbs and my boyfriend is about 160 lbs. Both of us shared the bed and we were able to get a goods night rest. Easy to take out the air with the built in self inflate/deflate power. Def recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Intex Comfort Plush Mid Rise Dura-Beam Airbed with Built-in Electric Pump, Bed Height 13", Full
product_meta.description: The Comfort Plush Full Airbed is a part of the Dura-Beam series of airbeds that are providing amazing durability for years of lasting comfort. The secret is in the Fiber-Tech beam construction, which is comprised of thousands of high-strength polyester fibers that provide enhanced comfort, stability and support. Each bed is covered in plush flocking that is soft to the touch, and the horizontal air chambers provide added stability and support around the entire bed. The mattress is also equipped with a quality-tested, 20.8-gauge waterproof flocked top with 15-gauge vinyl beams and 16-gauge sides and bottom for durability. And best of all, the Comfort Plush mattress is remarkably easy to inflate thanks to the built-in, high-powered electric pump, which does its job in a mere 3 minutes. No more fussing with tiring hand or foot pumps or rummaging through the garage for your detached electric pump. And should the mattress feel a little too soft or firm, you can customize the comfort level with the touch of a button. The Comfort Plush is raised 13 inches from the floor, making it taller than most inflatable mattresses. And at 54 by 13 by 75 inches (W x H x L), the mattress is an official full size, making it a good fit for fitted sheets. The Comfort Plush Full bed--which offers a capacity of 600 pounds--is a terrific choice whether you're sleeping at the in-law's overcrowded house or setting up a guest bed in the basement. The mattress comes with an AC power cord and a duffel bag (for storage). Regarding Inflation: Measurements will vary based on the manner in which it is inflated and packaging disclaims “approximate size”. Airbeds are measured from the widest point including the beams (bulges) on the side and off the tallest point from the floor including built-in pillows if applicable. Location, temperature, and humidity will affect the airbed’s firmness. Airbeds will need to be occasionally re-inflated (topped off) to maintain desired firmness when used for more than a few days as vinyl tends to relax over time.If electrical power is not available then a separately operated pump can be connected to the control valve for inflation: simply turn the control dial to the inflation symbol, insert the air pump nozzle into the valve at the center of the control dial, and inflate the airbed. Do not use flammable substances (like aerosol tire repair products) with your airbed. The mattress may ignite or explode.
feature_bullets: Inflatable full airbed for home use, engineered with Fiber-Tech Construction
High-powered, built-in electric pump for hassle-free inflation and deflation, inflates mattress in approximately 3 minutes to the desired firmness
Waterproof flocked top with Dura-Beam technology, raised 13 inches from floor
Indented sides keep your fitted sheets from slipping
Duffel bag included for easy storage and transport
Dimensions: 54 x 13 x 75 inches (W x H x L), 600-Pound capacity

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
